inputs.selection_motivation: Copper price movements are strongly inversely correlated with the US Dollar Index (DXY), reflecting the impact of dollar strength on commodity demand and pricing.
inputs.candidate_motivation: Copper is a globally traded industrial metal whose price is driven by dollar strength, interest‑rate expectations, inflation outlook, and global demand.  These factors are reflected in US Treasury yields, Fed policy, the US dollar index, and major FX rates, while commodity peers (WTI, Brent, gold, wheat) and equity indices (S&P 500, Euro Stoxx 50) often move in tandem with copper.  Central‑bank policy and sovereign yields in the eurozone and UK also influence the metal through risk‑on/risk‑off sentiment.

proposed_link.motivation: Copper price movements are strongly inversely correlated with the US Dollar Index (DXY), reflecting the impact of dollar strength on commodity demand and pricing.
